detailed_info.name: Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate
detailed_info.description: Lauroyl Sarconisate sodium is a much milder anionic surfactant than sulfated compounds. Derived from fatty acid and natural amine, it is used in the composition of mild cleansing products and is also used in toothpastes.

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Cleansing
functions.description: Helps to keep a clean surface

functions.name: Emulsifying
functions.description: Promotes the formation of intimate mixtures between immiscible liquids by modifying the interfacial tension (water and oil)

functions.name: Foaming
functions.description: Capturing small air bubbles or other gases in a small volume of liquid by changing the surface tension of the liquid

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics
